meanings.definition: In a very severe or serious manner
meanings.sent1: She was grievously injured in the accident.
meanings.sent2: The storm grievously damaged the crops.
meanings.sent3: The cat grievously tried to fit into the tiny box.
meanings.sent4: His absence was felt grievously by all his friends.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's disappointment was written grievously on her face.

meanings.sent1: The grievously injured soldier was rushed to the hospital.
meanings.sent2: The grievously cold weather made everyone shiver.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked grievously at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident fell grievously on her ears.
meanings.sent5: The old man's face showed the marks of a grievously hard life.

meanings.sent1: She grievously underestimated the time needed to finish the project.
meanings.sent2: The company grievously miscalculated the market demand.
meanings.sent3: The cat grievously chased its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: His words grievously hurt her feelings.
meanings.sent5: The athlete grievously trained for the upcoming competition.
